summary:
Albert Brolsma (MSc Civil Eng.), has over 40 years of international consultancy experience working and living in Asia and Africa for most of his professional life. He is an experienced Technical Advisor and Manager of externally assisted projects in the fields of urban- and rural development. His experience with management and contract administration of complex, multi-disciplinary projects (including elements of institutional development, capacity building and training) has shown him to be Team leader and Technical Advisor with well developed social skills, capable to motivate colleagues and clients to achieve the project objectives.

Semi-retired since 2012, only available for short term missions (project identification, proposal preparation, backstopping assistance and project evaluation)

projects.title: Mali: Alatona Irrigation Project
projects.description: For MWH engineering consultants, Chief of Mission of a team of experts for management support of the client, the Millennium Challenge Account (MCA Mali). Funded by the Millennium Challenge Corporation (MCC) of the USA, MCA Mali is responsible for developing 5200 Ha of irrigated land (water of the Niger River provided by the Office du Niger) including resettlement of 8000 people affected by the project as well as the construction of the Niono-Goma/Coura road for the opening up of the region. The project is its final year (closing in September 2012) after which the management of the irrigation scheme will be handed over to a Water User Association of farmers with three tasks: (1) distribution of water, (2) maintenance of irrigation infrastructure and (3) collection of water fees.

projects.title: Burkina Faso: Local Development Programme in Sanguié and Boulkiemdé Provinces (PDLSaB)
projects.description: For Netherlands' Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Principal Technical Advisor and Chef d'équipe to PDLSaB (Netherlands funded Local Development Programme in Sanguié and Boulkiemdé Provinces: rural development activities in over 150 villages). Within the context of decentralised rural development, the Programme aimed to achieve sustainable socio-economic development in the two provinces through the reinforcement of the capacity of local institutions and organisations to master the process of participatory development: transfer the responsibility for the development of their own areas (selection of development activities on the basis of planning documents prepared by themselves, - tender, selection and contract-supervision by them as well)

projects.title: THAILAND: North East Water Management and System Improvement Project (NEWMASIP)
projects.description:
Financed by the European Union
Project co-director and leader of a team of sixteen consultants and over one hundred support staff of different professional backgrounds, providing technical assistance for a regional programme covering ten medium- and large-scale irrigation projects, aiming to increase farmers’ net incomes on a sustainable basis (project area 100,000 ha, budget 47 million Euro). Rehabilitation, completion and modernization of irrigation infrastructure, improved water management and maintenance, development of agricultural potential and marketing, institutional development and private sector development at farmer-, scheme- and community level and training, led to improved water security and agricultural production, to market oriented reforms (micro- and small scale enterprise development) and to higher farmer incomes. Institutional development based on a Scheme Management Development Model took place at both farmer and at scheme management staff level. Water User Co-operatives of farmers with three main functions viz. (1) water distribution and maintenance of irrigation infrastructure, (2) agricultural production and (3) marketing / business development were established and trained. Scheme Working Groups were developed, consisting of representatives of key government agencies and farmers who together plan and implement all scheme activities.

projects.title: ETHIOPIA: Small Scale Irrigation Project (SSIP),
projects.description:
Project funded by African Development Bank (AfDB)
Team Leader of a team of consultants and national staff aiming to increase food production and farmers’ incomes in a national programme covering ten irrigation schemes, through water resources development, modernising traditional peasant agriculture, improvement of irrigation facilities, improvement of water management, agricultural demonstrations, business & commerce development and training. Planning of project, design of civil works, construction planning and (force account) construction supervision, and training in operation & maintenance, agricultural production and micro business development / marketing, did start to impact on agricultural production, productivity and farmer incomes.

projects.title: Product Manager Water Supply and Sanitation
projects.description: Manager of water supply, sanitary engineering and environmental activities based at the company’s head office, engaged in project identification and formulation, project acquisition and management support missions of integrated environmental and sanitary engineering projects. Projects include water supply (gravity supply networks), drainage and flood protection, sewerage, wastewater treatment, solid waste removal, health education, institutional & (water) business development, natural resources development and training. Regular acquisition visits to the World Bank -Washington, United Nations -New York, European Union -Brussels, African Dev. Bank -Abidjan and Asian Dev. Bank -Manila. Preparation of prequalification documents, - of tender documents and tenders, - of supply contracts and of bid evaluations, and planning, organising, directing and assisting with project implementation.

projects.title: KENYA: Regional Representative and Manager of Euroconsult Branch Office in Nairobi
projects.description: Main duties: Establish and maintain contacts with potential clients (mostly Government agencies) and with donor organisations (Netherlands Government, European Development Fund, the World Bank, African Development Bank and national financing agencies) and do project acquisition. Conduct project identification-, formulation- and proposal preparation missions in Kenya, Sudan, Somalia, Madagascar and Tanzania, and technical- and management support missions to our on-going projects in the region. Set up and run a Supply Office for procurement and supply of project goods, construction materials and equipment, including set up and running of  tented bush camps and transport by air (charter) and with long haul convoys, of staff and supplies for projects in Kenya, South Sudan and Somalia.
